intro: Chytranthus flavoviridis, commonly known as the yellow-flowered chytranthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species in its native habitat.
